Package au.edu.anu.twcore.ecosystem.runtime.space

Interface Space<T extends Locatable>

All Known Subinterfaces:
DynamicSpace<T>, ObserverDynamicSpace
All Known Implementing Classes:
FlatSurface, SpaceAdapter, SquareGrid
public interface Space<T extends Locatable>
Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 28 janv. 2020

  • Method Details

    • boundingBox

      fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space.Box boundingBox()
      Every space is contained within a n-dim bounding box. This function returns the bounding box (useful for drawing the space).
      Returns:
      the space bounding box

    • observationWindow

      fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space.Box observationWindow()
      part of the space that is considered to compute statistics and outputs - enables to have a safety zone around the central space to reduce edge effects. NB in most cases it's = boundingBox().
      Returns:

    • ndim

      int ndim()
      Spaces can be 1,2,3,n-dimensional. This function returns their dimension.
      Returns:
      the space dimension

    • asGraph

      fr.cnrs.iees.graph.Graph<? extends fr.cnrs.iees.graph.Node,​? extends fr.cnrs.iees.graph.Edge> asGraph()
      A space can be represented as a graph of SystemComponents and SystemRelations. This function returns such a graph. Useful for space complexity comparisons.
      Returns:

    • asShape

      TwShape asShape()
      A drawable object representing this space
      Returns:

    • locate

      void locate​(T focal)
      Locates a system component within this space. This will trigger a call to SystemComponent.initialLocation()
      Parameters:
      focal - the system to add

    • unlocate

      void unlocate​(T focal)
      Removes the system component focal from this space.
      Parameters:
      focal - the system to remove

    • unlocate

      void unlocate​(Collection<T> focal)

    • precision

      double precision()
      ABSOLUTE precision (in space distance units), ie distance below which locations are considered identical. NB precision is used to assess if two points are at the same location
      Returns:
      the precision of location coordinates

    • units

      String units()
      Returns:
      the measurement unit of locations

    • type

      default SpaceType type()
      Returns:
      the SpaceType matching this particular descendant

    • getNearestItems

      Iterable<T> getNearestItems​(T item)
      gets all the items located at the shortest distance from the focal item, excluding itself. It allows for items having the same location. contract: always return a non-null (possibly empty) list
      Parameters:
      item -
      Returns:

    • getNearestItems

      Iterable<T> getNearestItems​(T item, int rank)
      gets the first rank neighbours of an item. It allows for items having the same location. contract: always return a non-null (possibly empty) list NB: more items than rank canbe returned if they are at the same distance.
      Parameters:
      item -
      Returns:

    • getItemsWithin

      Iterable<T> getItemsWithin​(T item, double distance)
      gets all items within a distance of the focal item. contract: always return a non-null (possibly empty) list
      Parameters:
      item -
      distance -
      Returns:

    • defaultLocation

      default double[] defaultLocation()

    • randomLocation

      double[] randomLocation()

    • clear

      void clear()
      clears all items EXCEPT those that were located with locateUnclearable

    • equalLocation

      default boolean equalLocation​(double[] reference, double[] candidate)
      A method to check that a series of numbers matches an (usually already existing) location. Locations are consider equal if their coordinates only differ by space precision.
      Parameters:
      reference - the reference location to compare to
      candidate - the candidate coordinates to compare to the reference
      Returns:
      true if candidate coordinates are not different from reference location coordinates

    • fixLocation

      double[] fixLocation​(double[] location)
      check and fix location of proposed point as per edge effect correction
      Parameters:
      location -
      Returns:

    • fixOtherLocation

      fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space.Point fixOtherLocation​(fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space.Point focal, fr.cnrs.iees.uit.space.Point other)
      fix location of other relative to focal according to edge effect correction
      Parameters:
      focal -
      other -
      Returns:
